Abstract: The CYBATHLON competition has emerged as a pivotal platform for advancing assistive technologies, fostering innovation through its unique blend of competition and collaboration. This event emphasizes user-centered design, directly involving people with disabilities in the development and testing of assistive devices. By simulating daily-life challenges, CYBATHLON not only showcases the latest technological advancements but also highlights the practical needs and preferences of end-users. This approach has significantly contributed to the creation of more effective, inclusive, and accessible technologies, enhancing the quality of life for individuals with disabilities. Furthermore, the competition serves as a catalyst for interdisciplinary collaboration, bringing together engineers, designers, healthcare professionals, and users to push the boundaries of what is possible in assistive technology. Through its global impact, CYBATHLON continues to inspire a future where technology empowers everyone, regardless of physical ability.
